ratings.comment: He's not a very good professor. Yes, he's very smart, and yes, if you pay attention you will learn a ton. But he's egotistical and nitpicky and uses 1000 words to say something that only needed 45. For some fun, count how many times he says "fact of the matter," "is the following" and "what i would call" each lecture. Study hard and you'll do fine
He speaks so fast and so much that it is difficult to follow. It is almost useless to attend lecture because you don't learn anything. I taught myself everything via Wikipedia.

Well, this has been by far the worst class I've ever taken at this school. He asks for very specific answers on exams that he may have mumbled once in class. It's very hard to distinguish what is important or what is just a "fun fact" about speech production. I truly feel for anyone who has to take this class in the future...
talks too fast. hw assignments are so ridiculous and have nothing to do with what you're learning in class. they're all math based.

Reading reviews made me a terrified to take his class, but it really isn't that bad. Yes, it's a lot of information, but it's straightforward - know what he gives you, and you'll do well. As long as you work hard and start studying early in advance, you'll be fine. I was pleasantly surprised that it didn't cause me more trouble as a gateway course.

Although I have not liked any of his other classes, I really enjoyed 371.  As long as you write in the same style as the examples he gives you, you should be fine.  Definitely not an easy class but it is a great way to end the com dis major.  Don't be afraid to take 371 with him!

Extremely difficult. If you want to get a good grade it is possible but the class will have to dominate your semester. Gives you all the tools and material to do well but there is simply so much. On the bright side this class will prepare you for later endeavors.

Hardest class that I have taken at UW-Madison. Westbury doesn't really care if his students do well. I'd be lying if I said tears were not shed over this class. Memorize everything and you will get by. After reading reviews I was scared my grade wouldn't be good enough for the gateway course average, but it wasn't an issue. GOOD LUCK!

Worst class I have ever taken. I studied every day of the semester and learned that your hard work doesn't even pay off. Exams are obnoxious and he tests you on the most insignificant things.Your entire grade is dependent on four exams and 3 homework assignments which are mainly math-based and have nothing to do with what you're actually tested on.

He is charming. Material is understandable- exams are rediculous. Memorize how to label parts of the body, even though that will only be a fraction of the exam... need to remember every detail, which if you don't hear him say something (he talks incredibly fast & rarely repeats info) then good luck. Not what I expected from an intro course.
Hard class but if you are willing to put in the effort you will do okay. You must read the material and take notes in class. Start studying a week in advance to do well on test.
Funny guy. Expects a lot, but really challenges you to learn. Easy to get a good grade if you put the time in. Wouldn't recommend the class if you aren't interested in speech science.
‎"Do any of us stutter? I don't know because I don't even know what that means." - John Westbury.  Pretty much, this quote sums up the whole class.
He talks so fast and you are unable to learn anything from lecture. You must memorize EVERYTHING and his tests are ridiculously difficult.

I have never studied so hard for a class in my life. It was very demanding, you need to start studying about a week beforehand to do well. John is a great professor and is always willing to help. If you put enough time into the class you can do well, the exams are curved. Talking to John outside of class also helps a lot; it is a great class.

Very difficult course. Exams are ridiculous. You pretty much just have to memorize EVERYTHING and anything. 4 exams. 3 homework. That's your entire grade. He speaks really fast & you miss pretty much everything.

Very intelligent man, which is evident by the way he lectures.  Material was very difficult to learn because it was straight memorization without any application other than diagrams.  Definitely the hardest of the 3 "gateway" courses for Com Dis.

Great class, bad lectures. Westbury talks waayyy too fast and he is aware of it too but doesn't want to do anythinga bout it. If you plan on taking this class bring a tape recorder and don't even bother taking notes..you'll just miss information.

At first his frequent asides and references are charming, but they soon become annoying and frustrating. It's 90% memorization, and extremely dry. Although he does provide you with all the information in power points and lecture notes, it is way too convoluted.  I agree with the person who commented on his ego.
Good teacher. Sometime boring in lecture. Gives you the powerpoints. Do the reading and study your notes and it is easy to do well in this course.

The course material is demanding, and he certainly doesn't lay it out in front of you on a silver platter. Lectures are sometimes confusing, but he provides review sheets and "what you need to know" handouts for most chapters. His test are completely obscure, but the grading is fair. I'd probably like him more if I didn't hate the course material.

He was a challenging professor but knew the material very well and explained it very thoroughly. If you put the effort and time into it, you will get the grade you want. It is not a simple class, but then again, no class is. The textbook wasn't really a textbook but you need to use it for the pictures.
Really not too bad.  People make too big of a deal of him.  Just go to class and you can easily get an A.  Pretty fair even easy grader.

The speed with which he teaches the class is very overwhelming. He puts a lot of responsibility for the material on your shoulders, and has no sympathy for the work load. If you miss a class, you're behind. Curves the test grades, so that helps. He's a talented and entertaining professor, but as a student you need to work hard.
class is way overrated.  not very difficult, easy A.  i was expecting it to be very tough and was pleasantly surprised.

John Westbury makes some cute little remarks that are funny.  I think the way he teaches the class forces students to dislike it.  The material goes way too fast and you only have enough time to cram, not to learn.
I thought Westbury was great, clear as to what we needed to know, exams were difficult but not unexpected. Plus, he's so cute!

Ok, so John is a genius, but he can't seem to get past his ego that he's better then everyone eles and see that his students are people. When he teaches, he bounces from one topic to another and always assumes that you are understanding what he says.  Best advice is to study everything.

John Westbury knows what he is doing and can communicate in a competent and clear manner.  His classes are difficult and demanding.  you learn so much from him... the Handbook of Stuttering will kill you though.  beware.
